I choose Nep-Nep!

She's a powerful melee bruiser with moderately higher-than-normal melee attack range.  She excels at dueling and chases, once she gets into a fight she wants to see it through without backing down.

**Passive:** When Neptune kills an enemy unit she gains 3 HP/1 Mana and a share stack, doubled for large minions/monsters and champion kills/assists.

**Q: Active:** Neptune jumps on an enemy bashing them with her giant sword and slowing them for a moderate duration.  Does damage equal to her current AD + extra base damage and some of her AP.  Applies on-hit.
**Q: Passive:** Cooldown is reduced each time Neptune performs an auto-attack.

**W: Active:** Neptune braces herself for the prolonged fight, healing some of her missing HP.  Scales a high amount of AP.
**W: Passive:** Neptune gains confidence from her allies, increasing her base stats slightly for each nearby ally.  Cooldown of active is reduced each time Neptune takes damage.

**E: Active:** Neptune swings her giant sword 180 degrees damaging, slowing and knocking-back enemies to the edge of her attack range.  Scales bonus AD and slight AP.

**R: First Active:** Neptune reverts to Purple Heart, her adult-like goddess form gaining bonus attack speed, movement speed and attack range.  She also gains bonus MaxHP, MaxMana, AD, AP, Armor and MR based on a percent of her shares stacks.
**R: Second Active:** After performing a number of auto-attacks while in HDD form, Neptune can re-active R a single time to dash around the battlefield dealing damage to each enemy hit once.  Scales moderately both AD/AP.
**R: Passive:** Maintaining HDD requires mana/second and while in this form, a % of the damage Neptune does is returned as mana.  Neptune will assume Human form when she runs out of enough mana to maintain HDD or doesn't perform an attack for 6 seconds.

After-notes: She's a heavy snowball champ with a moderately safe lane-phase thanks to increased sustain and high range.  She's rewarded for getting ahead in lane with slightly higher stats late-game in HDD and normal farming patterns.  The bonuses remain small enough and her aggressive and team-oriented kit deter the pattern of AFK-farming.  Her basic abilities are strong enough that she can still remain an asset while behind by sticking with her team.  Despite a lack of strong escape mechanics, the Jax-like hyper carry she gets when winning is split-bush viable as she'll be strong enough to solo 2 or 3 enemies alone.

I'm gonna strike while the iron is still hot and keep this train rolling.  Next up is the adorable, bad-tempered and foul-mouthed Blanc.  Her personality actually matches mine closely.  She'll be a front-line tank focused on disruption and locking down enemies.

**Passive:**  Blanc's basic attacks slow her target slightly and momentarily.  Killing a unit grants her a share stack, doubled against large minions/monsters and champion kills/assists.

**Q: Active: Human Form:**  Blanc slams her massive maul into the ground damaging and stunning enemies around her.
**Q: Active: HDD Mode:**  Blanc swings her Great-axe around stunning enemies and shredding a % of their armor.  Each champion hit past the first lowers the cooldown.

**W: Active:**  Blanc digs in to stand her ground reducing incoming damage for a time.  Taking damage increases the duration to a cap.
**W: Passive:**  Blanc has increased HP regen.

**E: Active:**  Blanc spins her giant weapon around to propel herself forward.  Enemies damaged by this are rooted for a short duration.

**R: First Active:**  Blanc reverts to her Goddess HDD form gaining bonus MaxHP, Armor and MR.  She also gets MaxHP/MP, AD/AP and Armor/MR for a percent of her shares stacks.
**R: Second Active:**  After landing a number of attacks, Blanc can re-activate R to dash from enemy to enemy cleaving each for an amount of damage scaling with her MaxHP.  She'll land centered of the enemies hit.
**R: Passive:**  Maintaining HDD mode costs mana/second, suffering damage restores her mana by a % calculated before damage reductions.  Blanc will assume human form when she no longer has the mana to maintain HDD or is out-of-combat for 6 seconds.

I'd pick Nekomaru Nidai from Super Dangan Ronpa 2, because I feel that he would fit in quite well with the champions of the league.

[](http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130804024332/danganronpa/images/f/f7/Nidai_sprite_1.png)

He would be a Tank/Support champion, and his entire kit would revolve around using his SHSL coaching talents to encourage his teammates to achieve victory, no matter how bad the odds may look.

**Passive: Coach's Aura**

Nidai's presence inspires his allies to perform their very best.  Allied champions near Nidai gain a 5% bonus to Attack Damage.

**Q: Words of Empowerment**

Nidai inspires his allies to fight with all their might.  Allied units gain a 5%/7.5%/10%/12.5%/15% (+ 0.1% for every 5 Ability Power) bonus to Attack Damage and Ability Power.

**W: Words of Courage**

Nidai inspires his allies to persevere through tough times.  Allied units gain a 5%/7.5%/10%/12.5%/15% (+ 0.1% for every 5 Ability Power) bonus to Armor and Magic Resist.

**E: Words of Urgency**

Nidai inspires his allies to work faster and harder.  Allied units gain a 5%/7.5%/10%.12.5%/15% (+ 0.1% for every 5 Ability Power) bonus to Attack Speed and Movement Speed.

**R: BURNING SPIRIIIIIIIIIT!**

Nidai blasts the area around him with his intense aura, dealing 100/200/250 (+ 100% Ability Power) to any enemy units in the area.  In addition, his allies are inspired to achieve beyond their supposed limits, healing nearby allies by 100/200/250 (+ 100% Ability Power).

I pick the Big Daddy from Bioshock. He'd pretty much be a slow melee tank, high base HP, Armor and MR, scaling mostly with AD and Health, and is resourceless. And no, Nautilus doesn't count. He has an anchor. BD has a drill. number/number indicates values at levels.

Passive: Made for the Depths (working title): Due to the bulk and strength of his suit, BD takes 2%/5%/10% less damage (Level 6/11/15) from champion basic attacks, and a flat 15% less damage from minions, monsters, and summons such as Yorick's ghouls and Tibbers.

Q: Drill Rush: BD revs up his drill and charges along a line, dealing a 120/150/180/210/250 physical damage plus scaling to anything in the line. Anything hit gains a bleed debuff, dealing 5/8/10/12/13 physical damage per second over 5 seconds. Scales with 20% bonus Health. CD: 10 seconds at all levels.

W: Rivet-ing: BD targets an enemy and fires his Rivet gun at them 3 times. Each hit deals 50/60/70/80/90 damage plus scaling, and applies on-hit effects such as lifesteal, Black Cleaver or ranged Frozen Mallet. Scales with AD. CD: 14/13/12/11/10 seconds

E: Proximity Bomb: BD throws a proximity bomb that sticks to the ground. When an enemy unit walks into the detection radius, or if the bomb lands on an enemy, the bomb will explode dealing 100/125/150/175/200 physical damage plus scaling. The bomb's detection radius is smaller than the explosion radius. The bomb does not give vision. Scales with AD CD: 19/18/17/16/15 seconds.

R: Protector's Rage: BD flies into a Rage, and gains 30/40/50 AD, Armor, and MR. Also, all abilities go on half cooldown when used while in Rage. Finally, BD gains an additional 5 AD, Armor and MR for every champion near him while in Rage, up to 45 bonus in all categories.
